backend/main.mo: Motoko backend with access control, user profiles, feed items, media uploads, and like toggling logic using list/map storage.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence report mapping features to source files, components, test IDs, and confidence levels.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: Collection of short summaries describing major frontend files and their purposes.
frontend/deploy/dfx-frontend-canister-as: Template showing correct dfx.json configuration for serving frontend/dist as canister assets and common deployment mistakes.
frontend/DEPLOYMENT.md: Deployment guide explaining how to correctly build and serve the Vite dist/ output for the frontend canister.
frontend/index.css: Tailwind CSS base and theme variables defining light/dark modes and global styling.
frontend/index.html: Main HTML entrypoint with PWA metadata, icons, cache-prevention headers, and root mount for the app.
frontend/public/manifest.webmanifest: PWA manifest defining app metadata, icons, colors, scope, and display settings.
frontend/public/sw.js: Implements a service worker with versioned static/runtime caches, network-first and cache-first strategies, and exclusions for backend API calls.
frontend/scripts/deploy-frontend-prod.sh: Builds the frontend, verifies build and canister config, then deploys the frontend canister to production.
frontend/scripts/verify-dist-shell.ts: Validates Vite dist output by checking index.html, bundled assets, and required static files before deployment.
frontend/scripts/verify-frontend-caniste: Checks dfx.json to ensure the frontend canister uses dist as its source, is type assets, and is correctly configured.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Main app component handling authentication state, service worker updates, PIN challenges, and conditional UI rendering.
frontend/src/components/auth/LoginButton: Provides login/logout button logic using Internet Identity with cache clearing and error handling.
frontend/src/components/auth/ProfileSetu: UI form allowing new authenticated users to enter and save their display name profile.
frontend/src/components/capture/VideoCap: Handles camera access and recording, manages recording state, errors, and returns a captured video file.
frontend/src/components/editor/MediaEdit: Provides UI for editing images or videos with filters, overlays, cropping, and trimming before exporting an edited file.
frontend/src/components/feed/FeedItem.ts: Renders a feed media item with playback, mute, like, and speed-control logic tied to active state and user interactions.
frontend/src/components/feed/FeedOverlay: Displays handle, caption, and optional controls overlayed at the bottom of a feed item.
frontend/src/components/feed/Interaction: Shows like, comment, share, and download actions for a feed item with authentication checks and UI feedback.
frontend/src/components/feed/SpeedContro: Dropdown control allowing users to change video playback speed.
frontend/src/components/feed/UploadButto: Floating button that opens the upload dialog if the user is authenticated.
frontend/src/components/feed/UploadDialo: Manages uploading media with file validation, capture, editing, progress tracking, and caption input.
frontend/src/components/feed/VideoFeed.t: Scrollable video feed that tracks active item via IntersectionObserver and supports programmatic scrolling.
frontend/src/components/feed/VideoFeedIt: Stub file exporting nothing to avoid build errors; real implementation is in FeedItem.tsx.
frontend/src/components/feed/VideoOverla: Renders play/pause and mute controls as overlay buttons on a video.
frontend/src/components/search/SearchBut: Button that opens the search dialog when clicked.
frontend/src/components/search/SearchDia: Search modal with debounced queries, result listing, and identity check.
frontend/src/components/security/PinChal: Dialog prompting the user for a PIN with attempt tracking and verification.
frontend/src/components/security/Securit: Button that opens the security setup dialog.
Two-step dialog for setting a PIN and security questions, saving via useSecuritySetup.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Creates and caches a backend actor tied to identity, refetching dependent queries on change.
frontend/src/hooks/useDeviceTrust.ts: Manages a stored device ID and tracks whether the device is recognized or trusted.
frontend/src/hooks/useDoubleTap.ts: Hook that detects double-tap or double-click gestures and triggers a callback.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Provides a React context and provider for managing Internet Identity authentication, including loading, login, logout, and status tracking.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Defines React Query hooks for fetching feed items, uploading media with progress, and optimistically toggling likes using the actor and identity.
frontend/src/hooks/useSecuritySetup.ts: Manages persistent user security setup (PIN and questions) in localStorage with save and verification helpers.
frontend/src/index.css: Tailwind base styles plus custom theme variables, layout rules, scrollbar hiding, safe-area padding, and mobile viewport fixes.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Bootstraps the React app with QueryClientProvider and InternetIdentityProvider.
frontend/src/utils/downloadMedia.ts: Utility to fetch a media URL, convert it to a blob, and trigger a download via a temporary link.
frontend/src/utils/mediaEdits.ts: Includes browser-side image editing using canvas and placeholder video editing that returns the original file.
frontend/src/utils/urlParams.ts: Helpers for getting, persisting, and clearing URL parameters across query strings, hash routing, and sessionStorage.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind configuration extending theme colors, typography, animations, and container settings with custom CSS variables.
frontend/vite.config.ts: Vite setup with React, environment variable plugins, path alias, build options, dev server proxy, and dependency optimization settings.
project_state.json: Defines project state, goals, architectural notes, existing issues, and desired features for a TikTokâ€‘style PWA with upload, search, security, settings, and distribution improvements. Lists known frontend build, routing, and media handling problems to fix.
